docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, July 27-- Fritz Mandl, the notorious Austrian armaments magnate who, except for one week, has been under arrest in Buenos Aires since April 2 of this year, arrived in Colonia, Uruguay, today, having secured his release from President...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, July 27-- Fritz Mandl, the notorious Austrian armaments magnate who, except for one week, has been under arrest in Buenos Aires since April 2 of this year, arrived in Colonia, Uruguay, today, having secured his release from President Edelmiro J. Farrell yesterday.
docs.abstract: Bars F Mandi, freed from arrest in Argentina

headline.main: URUGUAY BARS MANDL, FREED BY ARGENTINA

byline.original: By Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, July 28-- Fritz Mandi, notorious Austrian armaments magnate who yesterday arrived suddenly by air in Colonia, Uruguay, and was promptly arrested there, returned to Buenos Aires by boat this morning.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, July 28-- Fritz Mandi, notorious Austrian armaments magnate who yesterday arrived suddenly by air in Colonia, Uruguay, and was promptly arrested there, returned to Buenos Aires by boat this morning.
docs.abstract: Mandl, given choice of leaving country or submitting to investigation, leaves country

headline.main: MANDL AGAIN FINDS ARGENTINA AHAVEN; Austrian Munitions Magnate Leaves Uruguay--Insists He Has No Nazi Tie-Up

docs.lead_paragraph: The Foreign Bondholders Protective Council, Inc., in its report for the years 1941 through 1944 on publicly offered dollar bonds of foreign governments and their political subdivisions, reveals that in that period the over-all percentage of defaults increased from 43 to 49 per cent.

byline.original: By CAMMILLE M. CIANFARRA Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 18 (AP)--Willy Koehn, former German Consul General in Spain and a key figure in pre-war Nazi infiltration of South America, was declared by Argentine exiles today to be in hiding in Patagonia with the knowledge of the Buenos...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 18 (AP)--Willy Koehn, former German Consul General in Spain and a key figure in pre-war Nazi infiltration of South America, was declared by Argentine exiles today to be in hiding in Patagonia with the knowledge of the Buenos Aires Government.

headline.main: NAZI HINTED IN PATAGONIA; Koehn, Ex-Consul in Spain, Said to Have Landed From U-Boat
